commit_message:
Add spec on refactor the inventory

A very hard work with very little rewards.

Change-Id: If484020420ff17df8ea682c0ceb7450acd0e4325
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-specs refs/changes/70/559070/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Refactoring OSA inventory ######################### :date: 2018-02-19 22:00 :tags: osa, inventory Inventory is currently rotting, is just a big pile of technical debt, and should be cleaned up. Something must be done. Problem description =================== The current OpenStack-Ansible inventory provide many features, all of them were included into a single dynamic inventory script, because at the time of its creation, only one inventory was allowed at a time in an ansible cli call. The dynamic inventory shipped by OSA is core of the functionality of OpenStack-Ansible, yet it didn't get enough love in the last cycles. As a result, the inventory grew and grew over time, but nothing cleaned it up. However, at this point, because of the lack of tests, it's too fragile to touch. On top of that, there are more and more components that were introduced in OpenStack-Ansible, and the default inventory grew over time. For optimizing our deployments, we should simplify the inventory. Proposed change =============== Now that we are using Ansible 2.4 and above, we can use multiple tools to replace the dynamic inventory with an inventory easier to read and which is standard ansible: #. Ansible ships a convenient tool to convert a inventory script into a static yaml file. That should be easier to manage for users. #. Ansible allows multiple inventories to merge together. What I am proposing is to use static files for inventory. It is easier for people to edit the inventory, and review it. It's easier to manipulate, and doesn't require code. However, we are losing some key features if we "just use" a static inventory which is created by the user. So I propose the following path: #. Keep the dynamic inventory script for now, but change its scope. Instead of running at all the ansible calls (which causes some issues on the archiving), we *could* use the script to generate a "static" json file. This way, the interface doesn't change directly, and we keep the features of the dynamic inventory at the beggining (generation of hostnames and vars for containers which aren't explicitly created by the user). That dynamic inventory script could become TOTALLY optional at that point: We can document what is required in a build, and ask deployers to provide their own group/host mapping. To make sure deployers don't misunderstand the "static" json file, and the current json "cache" / generated inventory, we should move the files to a "cache" folder, and the generated inventory (``legacy.json``) into a ``inventory`` folder. #. In our code, we can provide a yaml or INI inventory to provide a basic skeleton of the groups required to deploy openstack. That would provide some form of convenience when people use their own inventory. #. We write a tool to cleanup the json from ``legacy.json`` to ``static.json``. This would help reducing the size of the inventory. Global variables from ``openstack_user_config`` can be moved to ``user_ouc.yml``, #. We add documentation to explain how to convert an inventory from json to yaml by calling ``ansible-inventory``. #. We (optionally) provide a new tool to generate the ``static.json`` based on what we learned from users, which won't necessary use the openstack_user_config, conf.d, or env.d Alternatives ------------ Another spec is opened for a cleanup approach instead of a big bang approach: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554453 Playbook/Role impact -------------------- No impact on playbooks directly. Upgrade impact -------------- Upgrade can run the convert from dynamic json to static json during the upgrade. It would not change anything. However, we should maybe exercice the tooling to cleanup the inventory in the upgrades later. Security impact --------------- By shipping less code it would marginally improve our security. Or just not change anything. Performance impact ------------------ * Moving from dynamic to static file with the same format doesn't change performance * Moving from static json to static yaml may or may not improve performance in your deploy by reducing memory usage. It fully depends on the inventory. Large inventories are more likely to lose performance by switching to yaml for the same input. * Cleaning up the inventory have a positive performance impact. End user impact --------------- The end users will not notice any change. Deployer impact --------------- The deployer will have a different user interface to deal with. Hopefully it shouldn't be too hard to understand for an existing openstack-ansible user, or a experienced ansible user. Developer impact ---------------- No change for the development of roles or playbooks. Dependencies ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: evrardjp Other contributors: None for now. Work items ---------- See proposed change items. Testing ======= All the work items would be separately tested in the integrated gates. Documentation impact ==================== Large. The inventory would need a refactor to explain the expectations for people coming with their inventory, and for people that will use our generation tool. At the last step, if another tool is provided, it would also require documenting. References ========== None

commit_message:
Correct forwarding graph 'id' to match 'chain_id' in port chain

This patch lets forwarding graph 'id' to match 'chain_id' in
port chain. When users don't provide forwarding graph 'id',
that 'id' will be updated automatically by port chain creation
in networking-sfc.

Change-Id: I4e1dba75078593ba35f3995a26336ed538669579

commit_message:
Make index retention calculation pluggable

This allows alternate algorithms to be developed and enables the
same tasks to be included in a test to verify the planned retention
does not exceed the cluster storage capacity.

Change-Id: Ie3d80d6cfad16b946ccd790859bc7cd92b90fdef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/48/586348/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - name: Set assumed buffer storage fact set_fact: es_assumed_buffer_storage: "{{ ((es_total_available_storage | int) * 0.25) | round | int }}" - name: Set usable buffer storage fact(s) set_fact: es_usable_buffer_storage: "{{ (es_total_available_storage | int) - (es_assumed_buffer_storage | int) }}" es_expected_storage: "{{ ((elastic_beat_retention_policy_hosts.values() | map('int') | list) | sum) * (elastic_beat_storage_constant | int) }}" - name: Set buffer storage fact set_fact: es_assumed_usable_storage_per_node: "{{ (es_usable_buffer_storage | int) // (data_nodes | length | int) }}" - name: Set storage the mulitplier set_fact: es_storage_multiplier: "{{ ((es_usable_buffer_storage | int) < (es_expected_storage | int)) | ternary(((elastic_beat_storage_constant | int) * 2), elastic_beat_storage_constant | int) }}" - name: Set retention facts set_fact: "elastic_{{ item.key }}_retention={{ (es_assumed_usable_storage_per_node | int) // ((item.value | int) * (es_storage_multiplier | int)) }}" when: - hostvars[inventory_hostname]["elastic_" + item.key + "_retention"] is undefined with_dict: "{{ elastic_beat_retention_policy_hosts }}"

subject: Move MQ vhost/user creation into role
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-17 21:09:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift/commit/f46fdb9422bc5ba12cca76d52e9bb812cdb2acb0', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- swift_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- swift_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I3d5e00e090d37ea7aa95460965749ef066b63b23
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-07-17 21:24:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift/commit/c7126301810cbc423e470fad7c79b8faecfa7876', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the

commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement the new variable:
- swift_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

This is used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/584630
Change-Id: I3d5e00e090d37ea7aa95460965749ef066b63b23
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift refs/changes/93/583393/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: swift_oslomsg_notify_host_group: "{{ oslomsg_notify_host_group | default('rabbitmq_all') }}" swift_oslomsg_notify_setup_host: "{{ (swift_oslomsg_notify_host_group in groups) | ternary(groups[swift_oslomsg_notify_host_group][0], 'localhost') }}" swift_oslomsg_notify_transport: "{{ oslomsg_notify_transport | default('rabbit') }}" swift_oslomsg_notify_servers: "{{ oslomsg_notify_servers | default('127.0.0.1') }}" swift_oslomsg_notify_port: "{{ oslomsg_notify_port | default('5672') }}" swift_oslomsg_notify_use_ssl: "{{ oslomsg_notify_use_ssl | default(False) }}"swift_oslomsg_rpc_host_group: "{{ oslomsg_rpc_host_group | default('rabbitmq_all') }}" swift_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host: "{{ (swift_oslomsg_rpc_host_group in groups) | ternary(groups[swift_oslomsg_rpc_host_group][0], 'localhost') }}"
deleted_lines: swift_oslomsg_notify_transport: rabbit swift_oslomsg_notify_servers: 127.0.0.1 swift_oslomsg_notify_port: 5672 swift_oslomsg_notify_use_ssl: False

commit_message:
Add Monasca Agent container

The Monasca Agent consists of 3 processes. The collector, which
collects system level metrics from a host, a statsd server, which is used
to receive application specific statsd metrics and a forwarder service
which batches metrics and sends them to the Monasca API at pre-defined
time intervals.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers
Change-Id: Ia446ca0a6b932c2429d727b63e363b4e27307304

commit_message:
Set update_repo to gating_repo_name parameter

In previous releases we used gating_repo_name parameter
to set the repositories to be used to update container
packages. After moving it to tripleo-modify-image role,
repo name is hardcoded to gating-repo but in some cases
we need to use a different name (as in RDO rdoinfo jobs),
so making it configurable using the same parameter seems
to be a good option.

Change-Id: I1a7a9edde53ecc85bb347f3c7dc3140aac06985e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/27/582327/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: update_repo: "{{ gating_repo_name|default(gating-repo) }}"

Handle multiattach attribute when managing volumes

This patch handles the multiattach attribute when
managing existing volumes.

Change-Id: Iddaf012da4c91eaa9b4fabe04f235d330f22b890

commit_message:
Verify docker API version if runtime is specified

The 'runtime' parameter is supported in Docker API version 1.26
or later. This patch add a validation on this requirement.

In addition, this patch allows Zun to work with legacy Docker
API version if 'runtime' parameter is not specified.
Right now, Kolla is using Docker API version 1.24 so it requires
this fix to make it work.

Change-Id: I04fb640977bfb6e0e5771806c9327b347fe8ed48
(cherry picked from commit c0ad682b005d9e0f27846329136dde3350cedf65)

subject: Clone Zun repository by TARGET_BRANCH
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-19 12:52:54.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/zun'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zun/commit/c8b1e8847132f91e140d2a9277a446e338431f7f', 'message': 'Clone Zun repository by TARGET_BRANCH

The variable $TARGET_BRANCH will be set by devstack. It will point
to the right branch that the devstack is based on. For example,
if the devstack is on a stable branch, TARGET_BRANCH will point to
that stable branch. Using this variable will save us the manual
effort to update the branch whenever we cut a release.

Change-Id: If71cd66e28ca44ec2af4c6a6daaa9db74b49186b
(cherry picked from commit b7bbf97bdc4b684d5ca3ce8c0e4a67c96a697168)
'}]
commit_message:
Clone Zun repository by TARGET_BRANCH

The variable $TARGET_BRANCH will be set by devstack. It will point
to the right branch that the devstack is based on. For example,
if the devstack is on a stable branch, TARGET_BRANCH will point to
that stable branch. Using this variable will save us the manual
effort to update the branch whenever we cut a release.

Change-Id: If71cd66e28ca44ec2af4c6a6daaa9db74b49186b
(cherry picked from commit b7bbf97bdc4b684d5ca3ce8c0e4a67c96a697168)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zun refs/changes/54/583954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ZUN_BRANCH=${ZUN_BRANCH:-$TARGET_BRANCH}

commit_message:
Adds ramdisk deploy driver

Adds a pxe deploy driver to support the concept
of a deployment just consisting of a ramdisk.

Ideally, as long as a kernel and ramdisk are
defined, either by the operator or via a glance
image, the PXE/iPXE template should point the
booted kernel to using ramdisk as the root.

In theory, this would allow deployment via
nova, or directly using the parameters posted
to the node's instance_info.

There may be additional features realistically
needed for this to be beyond minimally useful,
but that would also depend on the contents of
the ramdisk that is deployed by an API user.

Change-Id: Id7067527cba27ed49753736f33ccb35e9b35bcba
Story: 1753842
Task: 10666

commit_message:
zun: add property 'networks' to container

Add a new property 'networks' to resource OS::Zun::Container.
This property is an ordered list of nics to be added to this container,
with information about connected networks, fixed ips, port etc.
This property can be updated without replacement.

Story: 2003106
Task: 23222
Change-Id: I4b8c0257b83e97444dd8ff6ce88e240d12278ec2

NETWORK_FIXED_IP, NETWORK_PORT, ) = ( 'network', 'fixed_ip', 'port', NETWORKS: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.LIST, _('An ordered list of nics to be added to this server, with ' 'information about connected networks, fixed ips, port etc.'), schema=properties.Schema( properties.Schema.MAP, schema={ NETWORK_ID: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Name or ID of network to create a port on.'), constraints=[ constraints.CustomConstraint('neutron.network') ] ), NETWORK_FIXED_IP: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('Fixed IP address to specify for the port ' 'created on the requested network.'), constraints=[ constraints.CustomConstraint('ip_addr') ] ), NETWORK_PORT: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('ID of an existing port to associate with this ' 'container.'), constraints=[ constraints.CustomConstraint('neutron.port') ] ), }, ), update_allowed=True ), def translation_rules(self, props): rules = [ translation.TranslationRule( props, translation.TranslationRule.RESOLVE, translation_path=[self.NETWORKS, self.NETWORK_ID], client_plugin=self.client_plugin('neutron'), finder='find_resourceid_by_name_or_id', entity='network'), translation.TranslationRule( props, translation.TranslationRule.RESOLVE, translation_path=[self.NETWORKS, self.NETWORK_PORT], client_plugin=self.client_plugin('neutron'), finder='find_resourceid_by_name_or_id', entity='port')] return rules networks = self.properties[self.NETWORKS] or [] for network in networks: self._validate_network(network) def _validate_network(self, network): net_id = network.get(self.NETWORK_ID) port = network.get(self.NETWORK_PORT) fixed_ip = network.get(self.NETWORK_FIXED_IP) if net_id is None and port is None: msg = _('One of the properties "%(id)s" or "%(port_id)s" ' 'should be set for the specified network of ' 'container "%(container)s".' '') % dict(id=self.NETWORK_ID, port_id=self.NETWORK_PORT, container=self.name) raise exception.StackValidationFailed(message=msg) # Don't allow specify ip and port at the same time if fixed_ip and port is not None: raise exception.ResourcePropertyConflict( "/".join([self.NETWORKS, self.NETWORK_FIXED_IP]), "/".join([self.NETWORKS, self.NETWORK_PORT])) networks = args.pop(self.NETWORKS, None) if networks: args['nets'] = self._build_nets(networks) def _build_nets(self, networks): if not networks: return None nics = [] for idx, net in enumerate(networks): nic_info = {'network': net.get(self.NETWORK_ID) or None} if net.get(self.NETWORK_PORT): nic_info['port'] = net[self.NETWORK_PORT] # if nic_info including 'port-id', do not set ip for nic if not nic_info.get('port'): if net.get(self.NETWORK_FIXED_IP): ip = net[self.NETWORK_FIXED_IP] if netutils.is_valid_ipv6(ip): nic_info['v6-fixed-ip'] = ip else: nic_info['v4-fixed-ip'] = ip nics.append(nic_info) return nics

commit_message:
Loosen docutils requirement pin

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573474 introduced a
problematic pinned requirement for docutils==0.11
which can't be supported across the various distros
that we need to support.

Change the requirement from strict equality to
greater-than-or-equal.

Change-Id: I92fcf6a516339a660395e5cd48e0a496158447e8

commit_message:
Update os_client_config to openstack.config

Since now os-client-config has been superceded by openstacksdk[1].
So need to replace the os-client-config in zaqarclient to
slove the issue that 'No module named os_client_config'.

[1]:https://docs.openstack.org/os-client-config/latest/

Change-Id: Icd133a467dea36f60d00f75a1113fcdf8e7ac76b

commit_message:
Rename unittest path openstack to openstack_resources

`openstack` is conflict with import path from openstacksdk, which lead to every
unittest under same level of `heat/tests/` must came out with complex way to
`import openstack` therefore change the path to `openstack_resources` is easier
way.

Change-Id: Ifb65f8e56222e9665e64d86b135271323bd23d0f

commit_message:
Support `cloud_provider` prop in remote stack

This property will allow remote stack to fetch authentication
information from clouds.ymal. See [1] for more information.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/latest/
configuration/index.html#clouds-yaml

Change-Id: I0393f07c0d2d915d01fda14451885fb958c6b307
Story: #2002126

commit_message:
Disallow actions when reference founded

Don't allow delete, abandon, or update Stack when Stack been
referenced by other Stack. Raise `ActionNotSupportedWithReference`
when referenced stack try to do above actions.
TODO: ADD tests

Change-Id: Iae1080b35f6b2cc246920ad6eaa1c54e93f2d452

commit_message:
Add resource support for Stack Reference

Allow create Stack Reference when resource use external resource
(with `external_id`) and that external resource was created by Heat
service. Delete that Stack Reference only when resource (which
defined with `external_id`) was deleted or abandoned.

TODO: Add tests

Change-Id: If284bfc23283c56b2e519a0af7089ca37cfbb389

commit_message:
libvirt: Revert non-reporting DISK_GB if sharing

Change Iea283322124cb35fc0bc6d25f35548621e8c8c2f went part way toward
implementing proper accounting for sharing providers, but the gaps it
left are untenable - see the associated bug report.

This removes the main functional piece of that change with TODOs to
reinstate it once the broader issues have been resolved.

Change-Id: I245a16315f97d0c2ca69c6ca9727a55a8ceb75ab
Related-Bug: #1784020

commit_message:
update requirements for neutron-lib 1.18.0

Neutron-lib 1.18.0 is our Rocky RC and is already being used by neutron
[1]. This patch updates the neutron-lib required version to match
neutron [1] in prep for the Rocky release.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583671/

Change-Id: Ia1d0cc983d51963fe79bf2fcaaf934669a066340

commit_message:
Mount my.cnf.d into the db_sync container for Barbican and Octavia.

This ensures that the generated my.cnf.d configurations are present
in the Barbican and Octavia db_sync containers. Without these settings,
a MySQL authentication error stops the db sync when TLS is enabled for
MySQL.

Change-Id: I8aaabf013b50b963e9a973b2ccedcbd4f6a9197d
Closes-Bug: 1782392

added_lines: from tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc @utils.requires_ext(extension='binding', service='network') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="neutron", rule="create_port:mac_learning_enabled", expected_error_code=403) @decorators.idempotent_id('98fa38ab-c2ed-46a0-99f0-59f18cbd257b') def test_create_port_mac_learning_enabled(self): # Feature available on VMWareNSX installations. unrecognized = "Unrecognized attribute(s) 'mac_learning_enabled'" post_body = {'network': self.network, 'mac_learning_enabled': True} with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self): try: self.create_port(**post_body) except lib_exc.BadRequest as e: if unrecognized in e.resp_body["message"]: msg = "Feature available on VMWare-NSX installations" raise self.skipException(msg) "create_port:fixed_ips", expected_error_codes=[403, 403, 403])

commit_message:
update requirements for neutron-lib 1.18.0

Neutron-lib 1.18.0 is our Rocky RC and is already being used by neutron
[1]. This patch updates the neutron-lib required version to match
neutron [1] in prep for the Rocky release.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583671/

To work with neutron-lib 1.18.0, we need Rocky version of neutron,
so the minimum version of neutron is bumped to 13.0.0.0b2 (Rocky-2).

We also need to bump the minimum version of SQLAlchemy. Rocky neutron
depends on pending_to_persistent ORM event in SQLAlchemy which was added
in SQLAlchemy 1.1. Rocky neutron now requires SqlAlchemy>=1.2.0,
so the min version of SQLAlchemy is bumped to 1.2.0.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ifa33d7bc000ebbcf5e0f130fe0e0e34207f3361c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-dynamic-routing refs/changes/75/584875/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add nova-status upgrade check for request spec migrations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-11 18:34:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/cmd/test_status.py', 'releasenotes/notes/nova-status-check-requestspec-migration-2a3b50b98fff9324.yaml', 'doc/source/cli/nova-status.rst', 'nova/cmd/status.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/e73f828057f8ec3d0693f1c498e59600caf1eeb6', 'message': "Add nova-status upgrade check for request spec migrations

We can't easily add a blocker db sync migration to make
sure the migrate_instances_add_request_spec online data
migration has been run since we have to iterate both cells
(for instances) and the API DB (for request specs) and that's
not something we should do during a db sync call.

But we want to eventually drop the online data migration and
the accompanying compat code found in the api and conductor
services.

This adds a nova-status upgrade check for missing request specs
and fails if any existing non-deleted instances are found which
don't have a matching request spec.

Related to blueprint request-spec-use-by-compute

Change-Id: I1fb63765f0b0e8f35d6a66dccf9d12cc20e9c661
"}]
commit_message:
Add nova-status upgrade check for request spec migrations

We can't easily add a blocker db sync migration to make
sure the migrate_instances_add_request_spec online data
migration has been run since we have to iterate both cells
(for instances) and the API DB (for request specs) and that's
not something we should do during a db sync call.

But we want to eventually drop the online data migration and
the accompanying compat code found in the api and conductor
services.

This adds a nova-status upgrade check for missing request specs
and fails if any existing non-deleted instances are found which
don't have a matching request spec.

Related to blueprint request-spec-use-by-compute

Change-Id: I1fb63765f0b0e8f35d6a66dccf9d12cc20e9c661
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/13/581813/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Recover python3 devstack jobs

During multinide jobs implementation, python3 job was lost.
This change recovers them into a initial state from multinode

Change-Id: I6ead3a7cdbb8bb25e6769713a2a5c9bafb1166b2
